ext_descriptions.ext_description: The boolean_operator_3d type enumerates the three boolean operators used in the definition of CSG solids.

The csg_primitive_3d type enumerates the solid primitives that can be represented by an instance of .
This enumeration may be extended in application modules that use the present module.
The definition of the various primitives can be obtained in ISO 10303-42.
a solid rectangular parallelepiped.
a type of CSG primitive with 8 vertices and 6 four-sided faces.
a partial Dupin cyclide solid.
a CSG primitive which is a generalisation of the right circular cone.
a type of CSG primitive in the form of a solid ellipsoid.
a type of CSG primitive with planar faces.
a solid pyramid with a rectangular base.
the result of intersecting a block with a plane perpendicular to one of its faces.
a CSG primitive in the form of a cone which may be truncated.
a CSG primitive in the form of a solid cylinder of finite height.
a CSG primitive with a spherical shape defined by a centre and a radius.
a type of CSG primitive with 4 vertices and 4 triangular faces.
a solid primitive defined by sweeping the area of a circle about a larger circle.

The swept_area_solid_type type enumerates the kinds of swept area solid.
This enumeration may be extended in application modules that use the present module.
The definition of the various kinds of swept area solid can be obtained in ISO 10303-42.
a solid formed by revolving a planar bounded surface about an axis.
a solid which is the result of sweeping a face along a directrix lying on a reference surface.
a solid defined by sweeping a bounded planar surface.

The swept_face_solid_type type enumerates the kinds of swept face solid.
This enumeration may be extended in application modules that use the present module.
The definition of the various kinds of swept face solid can be obtained in ISO 10303-42.
a solid of revolution formed by revolving a planar face about an axis.
a solid which is the result of sweeping a face along a directrix lying on a reference surface.
a solid defined by sweeping a planar face.

A Half_space_3d is a type of
that is the domain of space which lies on one side of an unbounded surface.
The surface shall divide the space domain into exactly two subsets.
The domain may be trimmed by an orthogonal box.
Specification of this entity is incomplete in the ARM. Further information can be obtained in the specification of the entity onto which it is mapped.
The side of the surface which determines the half space is obtained from the surface normal.

A Csg_model is a type of
defined by a collection of primitive solids, combined using regularised boolean operations. The allowed operations are intersection, union, and difference.
As a special case, a Csg_model can also include of a single CSG primitive.
A regularised subset of space is the closure of its interior, in the usual sense of point set topology. For boolean results, regularisation has the effect of removing dangling edges and other anomalies produced by the original operations.

A Manifold_solid_brep is a type of
that defines a solid by its external envelope and, when relevant, by one or more inner envelopes.
These envelopes shall either be defined with connected planar and polygonal facets or with scupltured surfaces.
